msContents.summary: The manuscript of Raṅganāthayati's Vaiṣṇavasadācāra āhnika granth. It explains about the every day rituals and also occasional rituals or ceremonies of a Vaiṣṇava. The first 4 folios of the mansucript consist of the part I of the āhnika granth named Yoga and then again some benedictory verses are repeated and description of other daily rituals is given. The scribe leaves a folio blank before every new topic begins. The maniscript is incomplete.

support.p: two blank palm leaf used as cover.

extent.measure: 6 guard folios, 11 blank folio, 165 written folio.

supportDesc.foliation: Tamil numeration in the left margin. Initial 4 folio are not numbered. Blank folio are without numbers. Numbering is not continuous.
supportDesc.condition: Good. some folio are worm-eaten at the corners or in the margin. Edges of some folio are broken.

handNote.desc: anusvāra is used instead of class nasals.

additions.desc:
On [11v] in the left margin is written ardhapuṇḍravidhiḥ. On [17v] in the left margin is written aṣṭākṣaravidhiḥ. On [35r] in the left margin is written vaiśvadevavidhiḥ. On [38r] in the left margin is written bhojanavidhiḥ. On [40v] in the left margin is written sāyaṃsaṃdhyāvidhiḥ. On [46v] in the left margin is written yatidharmavidhiḥ.
On [1v] of the second part of the manuscript heading is written in the left margin jayantinirṇaya.
[1r] in the left margin is written hariḥ oṃ. Similarly on [5r] in the left margin is written hariḥ oṃ.
[1r] of the Jayantinirṇaya in the left margin is written hariḥ oṃ śubhamastu.

binding.p: 2 blank palm leaves are used at the begining and a palm leaf end as a cover for the manuscript.

encodingDesc.p: one instance supplied a word na in śrīmate rāmānujāya[na]ḥ.
